page.title: 16Butterlaw Farm.
page.content: Butterlaw Farm was built in 1850 and it has 220 acres of land, 25 acres of winter barley and 20 acres of spring barley. There are sixty cattle on the farm and a Friesian cow with three suckling calves. There are no sheep on the farm because stray dogs chased them and thirty sheep fell in the stream and had to be rescued. There are no horses on the farm. The farmer has two dogs and one cat. There are five tractors on the farm and they pull a plough, a harrow and a baler. There is also a combine harvester. There is an opencast coal site beside the farm and the coal is loaded on to lorries and taken away. There were big heaps of earth on the open cast site.
